title: Being mixed race like Kamala Harris: 'I feel just as Indian as I feel black'
description: Three women who share Kamala Harris' mixed parentage open up about balancing the two sides of their lives.

title: Yuri Gagarin: Sixty years since the first man went into space
description: The BBC speaks to the woman who, as a child, witnessed Yuri Gagarin's return to Earth 60 years ago.

title: Why India and Nepal's forest fires are worrying scientists
description: Activists say authorities in India and Nepal seem underprepared to fight forest fires.

title: Oxford Street: Wooing shoppers back to Europe's busiest high street
description: Empty stores and American sweets - what consumers on Oxford Street can expect to see as shops reopen.

title: The 'Iron Man' body armour many of us may soon be wearing
description: The market for exoskeletons - high-tech external body support systems - is tipped to grow strongly.

title: Bafta Film Awards 2021: Snobbery, pianos and other takeaways
description: Even with social distancing there was plenty of humour, glamour and surprises at the virtual event.

title: Bafta Film Awards 2021: Nomadland and Promising Young Woman win big
description: The drama wins four prizes including best film, while Promising Young Woman wins best British film.

title: Bafta Film Awards 2021: Red carpet in pictures
description: The biggest night in the British film calendar, the Bafta Awards, is taking place in London.

title: Prince Philip: Duke's death has left 'huge void' for Queen - Duke of York
description: Prince Andrew was speaking after a service at the Royal Chapel of All Saints in Windsor on Sunday.

title: Prince Philip: Funeral an 'ideal opportunity' to end royal rifts, says Major
description: Shared grief over Prince Philip's death is an "ideal opportunity" to mend rifts within the Royal Family, Sir John Major says.

title: Glover takes gold with Swann in first event since 2016 - highlights & report
description: Helen Glover wins gold in her first competition for five years as she triumphs with Polly Swann at the European Rowing Championships.

title: NI riots: Adult influence in disorder 'amounts to child abuse'
description: Young people rioting in Northern Ireland are being "exploited", says the children's commissioner.

title: Nikki Grahame's friends 'heartbroken' at Big Brother star's death
description: Ex-Emmerdale actress Gemma Oaten posted an emotional video saying: "I wish I could have done more".

title: Elephant calf rescued from bottom of well in India
description: An elephant calf has been rescued from the bottom of a dug well in India's Odisha state.

title: St Vincent volcano: Power cuts after another 'explosive event'
description: Monitors report another "explosive event" at a volcano on the now ash-covered Caribbean island of St Vincent.

title: Sir Richard Sutton: Man charged with hotelier's murder
description: Thomas Schreiber is charged with murder, attempted murder and dangerous driving.

title: White given invitational tour card for next two seasons
description: Jimmy White is given an invitational tour card for the next two seasons on the World Snooker Tour.

title: Prince Philip: A simple, family farewell
description: A no-nonsense moderniser, the duke's last service to the monarchy may be in the way he departs it, reports the BBC's Jonny Dymond.

title: The Papers: Duke missed 'enormously' as funeral plans released
description: Sunday's papers carry Prince Charles's tribute to Prince Philip, who died on Friday at the age of 99.

title: Covid: Shoppers 'must respect staff' when retail reopens
description: People are urged to be considerate when non-essential retail rules ease in England and Wales on Monday.

title: Matt Hancock 'had private drink' with David Cameron and Lex Greensill
description: An ally of Matt Hancock tells the BBC he "acted in entirely the correct way" after the 2019 meeting.
